li.p: Write the standard form for a circle.
Divide both sides of this equation by r^2.
Compare the new equation with the standard form for an ellipse. What do you notice?

statement.p: Find all points with x-coordinate 1 on the graph of 9(x-3)^2+4(y-3)^2=36
Find the x-intercepts and the vertex of the graph of y = -0.5(x + 6)(x - 4)
Write an equation for the circle with center (-4, 5) and radius 8.

introduction.p: For problems 712, graph the circle or ellipse.

For problems 13 and 14
Fiind the equation of the ellipse.
Use your equation to complete the table.

For problems 15-18, each equation is a circle or ellipse.
State the radius or the lengths of the axes of the graph.
Give the exact coordinates of all points on the graph with the given x- or y-coordinate.

For problems 19 and 20,
Graph the ellipse.
Give the exact coordinates of any four points on the ellipse.

For Problems 2124:
Write the equation in standard form.
Graph the equation.
For Problems 2528, write an equation for the ellipse with the properties given.

statement.p: Vertices at (3, 2) and (-7, 2), minor axis of length 6
Covertices at (3,7) and (3,-1), major axis of length 10
Vertices at (-4, 9) and (-4, -3), covertices at (-7, 3) and (-1, 3)
The arch of a bridge forms the top half of an ellipse with a horizontal major axis. The arch is 7 feet high and 20 feet wide.

ol.label: a
ol.li: Find an equation for the ellipse.
How high is the arch at a distance of 8 feet from the peak?

statement.p: A doorway is topped by a semi-elliptical arch. The doorway is 230 centimeters high at its highest point and 200 centimeters high at its lowest point. It is 80 centimeters wide.

ol.label: a
ol.li: Find an equation for the ellipse.
How high is the doorway 8 centimeters from the left side?

statement.p: The wing of a World War II British Spitfire is an ellipse whose major axis is 48 feet. The minor axis is 16 feet, but part of the ellipse is cut off parallel to the major axis. This cut edge is 46 feet long.

ol.label: a
ol.li: Find an equation for the ellipse.
How wide is the wing at its center? Round your answer to two decimal places.

statement.p: The centerline of a sailboat from bow to stern along the bottom (its keel) is elliptical in shape, with a major axis of 360 centimeters. The minor axis of the ellipse is 100 centimeters, but the deck of the sailboat (the top of the ellipse) has been cut off parallel to the major axis. The deck of the sailboat is 330 centimeters long.

ol.label: a
ol.li: Find an equation for the ellipse.
What is the maximum distance from the deck to the bottom of the keel? Round your answer to two decimal places.
